action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A grassy area with many bicycles lying on the ground. Some of the bicycles are upright, and there are people standing and sitting around them. There are trees in the background.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: A black and white photo of a train, the front of the train is facing the camera. The train is on a track and there is a platform to the left of the train. There are some buildings in the background. The train is a diesel electric locomotive.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A grassy area with many bicycles lying on the ground. Some of the bicycles are upright, and there are people standing and sitting around them. There are trees in the background.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any buildings in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A black and white photo of a train, the front of the train is facing the camera. The train is on a track and there is a platform to the left of the train. There are some buildings in the background. The train is a diesel electric locomotive.
QUESTION: Are there any buildings in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the train moving? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
ANSWER: It appears to be stationary.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any other vehicles in your image besides bicycles?

ANSWER: It appears to be stationary.
QUESTION: Are there any other vehicles in your image besides bicycles? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any water in your image?

ANSWER: No.

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any signs or other markings on the ground in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Are there any signs or other markings on the ground in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any people in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are there any people in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
